alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:43AM CDT until April 01 at 9:35AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mobile AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Washington, Clarke and Choctaw Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 31.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
